suppress.notes: These CVEs are against versions less than 1.18 and we're on 1.18. False positives

This is not an issue since the vulnerability is in reading untrusted documents and platform-metrics-reporting only creates them. The issue is resolved in version 3.16 but will require code refactoring. poi-3.12.jar (cpe:/a:apache:poi:3.12, org.apache.poi:poi:3.12) : CVE-2017-5644
These CVEs are not an issue since the software is not exposing STOMP over WebSocket endpoints.

From security-core-api SecurityLogger. This is not an issue as we are not receiving logging messages via TCP or UDP socket. This can be fixed by upgrading to version 2.8.2. The version upgrade requires an update to karaf 4.1.1 log4j-api-2.4.1.jar (cpe:/a:apache:log4j:2.4.1, org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-api:2.4.1)

These CVEs apply to org.apache.geronimo:geronimo which is not a dependency of any of these artifacts.
geronimo-activation_1.1_spec-1.1.jar geronimo-javamail_1.4_spec-1.7.1.jar geronimo-jms_1.1_spec-1.1.1.jar geronimo-jms_2.0_spec-1.0-alpha-2.jar geronimo-servlet_3.0_spec-1.0.jar geronimo-stax-api_1.0_spec-1.0.1.jar apache-karaf-4.1.2.tar.gz: apache-karaf-4.1.2.tar: org.apache.servicemix.specs.saaj-api-1.3-2.9.0.jar/META-INF/maven/org.apache.geronimo.specs/geronimo-saaj_1.3_spec/pom.xml apache-karaf-4.1.2.tar.gz: apache-karaf-4.1.2.tar: org.apache.servicemix.specs.jaxws-api-2.2-2.9.0.jar/META-INF/maven/org.apache.geronimo.specs/geronimo-jaxws_2.2_spec/pom.xml
This CVE is related to hash collisions at the Java level. This is mitigated by newer versions of Java (8+). See http://openjdk.java.net/jeps/180 for more information. xercesImpl-2.11.0.jar
This CVE is related to a PHP script. There are no PHP scripts in the DDF.
These CVEs affect Jetty 9.3.x up to 9.3.23 and 9.4.x up to 9.4.10. DDF is using a version of jetty that does not fall within those ranges.
file name: solr-*.jar OWASP is getting confused by our version number being on a jar with solr in the name we are on solr 6.6+ which is not affected by this issue.
CVE-2016-1000031: Applies to commons-fileupload-1.2.1, suppressing because the vulnerable class DiskFileItem is not used in the project
A CVE against slf4j for the class "EventData", which is not used in DDF or pax-logging.
This is not an issue since the console and deploy directories are protected via other means
This is from Shiro Core 1.4.2 and can only be removed when DDF uses an upgraded version

This CVE comes from Spring, resolved in 5.1.13. Once we upgrade to that version this block can be removed. This is being excluded and not upgraded at present for two reasons 1) There is no current upgrade path for 5.1.13 - Spring has no native feature, we use the one provided by Karaf. Karaf has no version that uses newer Spring, and without ServiceMix having updated versions we can not create our own feature without forking their repo and updating Spring versions. 2) Because we do input validation on filenames, this CVE is not applicable to us and our usages.

This CVE has been addressed by upgrading commons-beanutils to version 1.9.3. OWASP will continue to report the vulnerability since OWASP sees the DDF version instead of the actual version. security-pdp-authzrealm-2.11.4-SNAPSHOT.jar (cpe:/a:apache:commons_beanutils:2.11.4, cpe:/a:apache:commons_collections:2.11.4, ddf.security.pdp:security-pdp-authzrealm:2.11.4-SNAPSHOT) security-sts-attributequeryclaimshandler-2.17.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
This list of CVEs comes from jackson-databind 2.8.11 which is included in pac4j 3.8.2, used in ddf.security.core. When this version of pac4j is upgraded we can remove the following list.
Applies to an LDAP class that we do not use in the system. - groovy-all-2.4.4.jar is only used in tests. - rest-assured 2.9.0 uses groovy-2.4.4.jar and groovy-xml-2.4.4.jar
This CVE is inherited from DDF and can be removed when pac4j is upgraded security core -> pac4j-oidc:jar:3.8.2 -> com.nimbusds:oauth2-oidc-sdk:jar:6.5
We don't use iBatis and we don't use Jackson default typing.
